5149enum class OpenRecordResult {
5150 kOK,
5151 kDiscard,
5152 kIncompleteRecord,
5153 kAlertCloseNotify,
5154 kError,
5155};
5156
5157// *** EXPERIMENTAL -- DO NOT USE ***
5158//
5159// OpenRecord decrypts the first complete SSL record from |in| in-place, sets
5160// |out| to the decrypted application data, and |out_record_len| to the length
5161// of the encrypted record. Returns:
5162// - kOK if an application-data record was successfully decrypted and verified.
5163// - kDiscard if a record was sucessfully processed, but should be discarded.
5164// - kIncompleteRecord if |in| did not contain a complete record.
5165// - kAlertCloseNotify if a record was successfully processed but is a
5166// close_notify alert.
5167// - kError if an error occurred or the record is invalid. |*out_alert| will be
5168// set to an alert to emit, or zero if no alert should be emitted.
5169OPENSSL_EXPORT OpenRecordResult OpenRecord(SSL *ssl, Span<uint8_t> *out,
5170 size_t *out_record_len,
5171 uint8_t *out_alert,
5172 Span<uint8_t> in);
5173
5174OPENSSL_EXPORT size_t SealRecordPrefixLen(const SSL *ssl, size_t plaintext_len);
5175
5176// SealRecordSuffixLen returns the length of the suffix written by |SealRecord|.
5177//
5178// |plaintext_len| must be equal to the size of the plaintext passed to
5179// |SealRecord|.
5180//
5181// |plaintext_len| must not exceed |SSL3_RT_MAX_PLAINTEXT_LENGTH|. The returned
5182// suffix length will not exceed |SSL3_RT_MAX_ENCRYPTED_OVERHEAD|.
5183OPENSSL_EXPORT size_t SealRecordSuffixLen(const SSL *ssl, size_t plaintext_len);
5184
5185// *** EXPERIMENTAL -- DO NOT USE ***
5186//
5187// SealRecord encrypts the cleartext of |in| and scatters the resulting TLS
5188// application data record between |out_prefix|, |out|, and |out_suffix|. It
5189// returns true on success or false if an error occurred.
5190//
5191// The length of |out_prefix| must equal |SealRecordPrefixLen|. The length of
5192// |out| must equal the length of |in|, which must not exceed
5193// |SSL3_RT_MAX_PLAINTEXT_LENGTH|. The length of |out_suffix| must equal
5194// |SealRecordSuffixLen|.
5195//
5196// If enabled, |SealRecord| may perform TLS 1.0 CBC 1/n-1 record splitting.
5197// |SealRecordPrefixLen| accounts for the required overhead if that is the case.
5198//
5199// |out| may equal |in| to encrypt in-place but may not otherwise alias.
5200// |out_prefix| and |out_suffix| may not alias anything.
5201OPENSSL_EXPORT bool SealRecord(SSL *ssl, Span<uint8_t> out_prefix,
5202 Span<uint8_t> out, Span<uint8_t> out_suffix,
5203 Span<const uint8_t> in);
5204
5205
5206// *** EXPERIMENTAL DO NOT USE WITHOUT CHECKING ***
5207//
5208// Split handshakes.
5209//
5210// Split handshakes allows the handshake part of a TLS connection to be
5211// performed in a different process (or on a different machine) than the data
5212// exchange. This only applies to servers.
5213//
5214// In the first part of a split handshake, an |SSL| (where the |SSL_CTX| has
5215// been configured with |SSL_CTX_set_handoff_mode|) is used normally. Once the
5216// ClientHello message has been received, the handshake will stop and
5217// |SSL_get_error| will indicate |SSL_ERROR_HANDOFF|. At this point (and only
5218// at this point), |SSL_serialize_handoff| can be called to write the handoff
5219// state of the connection.
5220//
5221// Elsewhere, a fresh |SSL| can be used with |SSL_apply_handoff| to continue
5222// the connection. The connection from the client is fed into this |SSL|, and
5223// the handshake resumed. When the handshake stops again and |SSL_get_error|
5224// indicates |SSL_ERROR_HANDBACK|, |SSL_serialize_handback| should be called to
5225// serialize the state of the handshake again.
5226//
5227// Back at the first location, a fresh |SSL| can be used with
5228// |SSL_apply_handback|. Then the client's connection can be processed mostly
5229// as normal.
5230//
5231// Lastly, when a connection is in the handoff state, whether or not
5232// |SSL_serialize_handoff| is called, |SSL_decline_handoff| will move it back
5233// into a normal state where the connection can proceed without impact.
5234//
5235// WARNING: Currently only works with TLS 1.01.2.
5236// WARNING: The serialisation formats are not yet stable: version skew may be
5237// fatal.
5238// WARNING: The handback data contains sensitive key material and must be
5239// protected.
5240// WARNING: Some calls on the final |SSL| will not work. Just as an example,
5241// calls like |SSL_get0_session_id_context| and |SSL_get_privatekey| won't
5242// work because the certificate used for handshaking isn't available.
5243// WARNING: |SSL_apply_handoff| may trigger msg callback calls.
5244
5245OPENSSL_EXPORT void SSL_CTX_set_handoff_mode(SSL_CTX *ctx, bool on);
5246OPENSSL_EXPORT void SSL_set_handoff_mode(SSL *SSL, bool on);
5247OPENSSL_EXPORT bool SSL_serialize_handoff(const SSL *ssl, CBB *out,
5248 SSL_CLIENT_HELLO *out_hello);
5249OPENSSL_EXPORT bool SSL_decline_handoff(SSL *ssl);
5250OPENSSL_EXPORT bool SSL_apply_handoff(SSL *ssl, Span<const uint8_t> handoff);
5251OPENSSL_EXPORT bool SSL_serialize_handback(const SSL *ssl, CBB *out);
5252OPENSSL_EXPORT bool SSL_apply_handback(SSL *ssl, Span<const uint8_t> handback);
5253
5254// SSL_get_traffic_secrets sets |*out_read_traffic_secret| and
5255// |*out_write_traffic_secret| to reference the TLS 1.3 traffic secrets for
5256// |ssl|. This function is only valid on TLS 1.3 connections that have
5257// completed the handshake. It returns true on success and false on error.
5258OPENSSL_EXPORT bool SSL_get_traffic_secrets(
5259 const SSL *ssl, Span<const uint8_t> *out_read_traffic_secret,
5260 Span<const uint8_t> *out_write_traffic_secret);
5261
5262
5263BSSL_NAMESPACE_END
5264
5265} // extern C++

5267#endif // !defined(BORINGSSL_NO_CXX)
